header.subtitle: Controlling a RGB LED-Strip with a Raspberry Pi

intro.title: Introduction
intro.text: This tutorial will explain how to control a RGB LED-Strip with a Raspberry Pi. It should work on all current Raspberry Pi boards.
intro.responsible: Attention: I'm not responsible for any damage to your LED-Strip or Raspberry Pi. Do this at your own risk!

requirements.title: What do you need?
requirements.rgbled: A RGB LED Strip (with 3 pins for RGB and 1 pin for 12V DC)
requirements.fitto: Has to fit with the power supply
requirements.withwires: I use one with screws so I can connect the wires easier
requirements.software: The software pigpio installed on the Raspberry Pi

mosfet.look: When you look from the front of the MOSFET's
mosfet.firstpin: the first pin from left is the Gate pin
mosfet.secondpin: the second pin is the Drain pin
mosfet.thirdpin: the third pin is the Source pin
mosfet.ontobreadboard: At first put the three MOSFET's in the breadboard
mosfet.toground: Then connect the source pins to the ground bus of the breadboard

led.connectcolor: Connect for each color the Drain pin to the associated color of the LED-Strip
led.supply: Also put a wire from the 12V pin of the LED-Strip in the supply voltage bus of the breadboard

pi.pins: Here is a overview over the GPIO pins of the Raspberry Pi:
pi.breadboard: At first connect one of the ground pins to the ground bus of the breadboard
pi.connectcolor: Also connect for each color one of the green pins to the Gate pin of a MOSFET
pi.hereused: I will use the following pins:

power.fasten: Fasten one wire with the ground and one with the voltage contact of the power jack in place
power.ground: Connect the ground wire to the ground bus of the breadboard
power.voltage: Then connect the voltage wire to the voltage bus of the breadboard
power.power: Also connect the power supply to the power jack
power.plugin: Now the power supply can be plugged into the outlet

testing.title: 6. Testing
testing.type: You can turn on the LED's with the following commands:
testing.red: pigs p 17 255 - The red part will be set up to 100% and the LED's should be red
testing.yellow: pigs p 22 128 - The green part will be set up to 50% and the LED's should be yellow
testing.purple: pigs p 24 128 - The blue part will be set up to 50% and the LED's should be purple
